channel.title: culture on Nathan R. Yergler
channel.description: Recent content in culture on Nathan R. Yergler

item.title: Let’s Talk about “Pickle Rick”
item.description: Yes, we no doubt live in a world where a lack of intelligence and a lack of awareness (self or otherwise) fail us at every turn.

item.title: Fox News is Lamer Than I Ever Imagined
item.description: I’ve been working at a local coffee shop for the past hour, and for most of that Fox News (on the obligatory, hideous plasma television) has been showing a car chase in LA.

item.title: And this suprises whom?
item.description: Since I’m traveling for two weeks and won’t get my hair did while on the road, I also won’t get my fix of People Magazine (and Teen People, natch).

item.title: Coolness Smackdown (or “How Much Does the Communist Party ♥ You?”)
item.description: Apparently I’m cooler than Mike — more accurately my domain is: yergler.

item.title: One Minute
item.description: Stop, take a minute, and reflect .

item.title: Uh, Bullshit
item.description: Hilary Rosen is guest-blogging for our esteemed chairman , and while it makes perfect sense in theory — CC is not about tearing down copyright, but about building a better system within it’s confines — I call bullshit.

item.title: Sandra D.! Say it ain’t So!
item.description: SCOTUS Blog has the report ; Sandra Day O’Conner is resigning.

item.title: Everybody Wants You
item.description: I’m doing some research on reasons for opposing same-sex marriage.

item.title: CC at Notacon
item.description: Yesterday was the first day of Notacon in Cleveland, OH.

item.title: Finding CC
item.description: We break from our continuing PyCon coverage to bring you this bulletin.

item.title: Lessig on NPR
item.description: Lessig appeared on the NPR show The Connection (originating from WBUR in Boston) to discuss the future of Free Culture.

item.title: CC on NPR
item.description: NPR’s Talk of the Nation featured an interview this afternoon with WIRED editor-in-chief Chris Anderson and Le Tigre’s Kathleen Hanna, discussing the WIRED CD.

item.title: “Rip. Sample. Mash. Share.”
item.description: Check it out, Creative Commons is mentioned in today’s Wall Street Journal.

item.title: Outfoxed, Out-licensed
item.description: Lessig reports that Robert Greenwald, Producer/Director of the anti-FOX News polemic (and damned fine film) Outfoxed , has released the original interview footage under a Creative Commons license.

item.title: Irrational Exuberance
item.description: You may have heard that Apple released a new version of the iPod this week.
